segment.source: Searching for Installed Compatibility Fixes with the Query Tool in Compatibility Administrator (Windows 10)
segment.target: Searching for Installed Compatibility Fixes with the Query Tool in Compatibility Administrator (Windows 10)

segment.source: You can access the Query tool from within Compatibility Administrator.
segment.target: You can access the Query tool from within Compatibility Administrator.

segment.source: The Query tool provides the same functionality as using the Search feature.
segment.target: The Query tool provides the same functionality as using the Search feature.

segment.source: Searching for Installed Compatibility Fixes with the Query Tool in Compatibility Administrator
segment.target: Searching for Installed Compatibility Fixes with the Query Tool in Compatibility Administrator

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: You can access the Query tool from within Compatibility Administrator.
segment.target: You can access the Query tool from within Compatibility Administrator.

segment.source: The Query tool provides the same functionality as using the Search feature.
segment.target: The Query tool provides the same functionality as using the Search feature.

segment.source: For information about the Search feature, see Searching for Fixed Applications in Compatibility Administrator.
segment.target: For information about the Search feature, see Searching for Fixed Applications in Compatibility Administrator.

segment.source: However, the Query tool provides more detailed search criteria, including tabs that enable you to search the program properties, the compatibility fix properties, and the fix description.
segment.target: However, the Query tool provides more detailed search criteria, including tabs that enable you to search the program properties, the compatibility fix properties, and the fix description.

segment.source: You can perform a search by using SQL SELECT and WHERE clauses, in addition to searching specific types of databases.
segment.target: You can perform a search by using SQL SELECT and WHERE clauses, in addition to searching specific types of databases.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: You must perform your search with the correct version of the Compatibility Administrator tool.
segment.target: You must perform your search with the correct version of the Compatibility Administrator tool.

segment.source: To use the Query tool to search for a 32-bit custom database, you must use the 32-bit version of Compatibility Administrator.
segment.target: To use the Query tool to search for a 32-bit custom database, you must use the 32-bit version of Compatibility Administrator.

segment.source: To use the Query tool to search for a 64-bit custom database, you must use the 64-bit version of Compatibility Administrator.
segment.target: To use the Query tool to search for a 64-bit custom database, you must use the 64-bit version of Compatibility Administrator.

segment.source: Querying by Using the Program Properties Tab
segment.target: Querying by Using the Program Properties Tab

segment.source: You can use the Program Properties tab of the Query tool to search for any compatibility fix, compatibility mode, or AppHelp for a specific application.
segment.target: You can use the Program Properties tab of the Query tool to search for any compatibility fix, compatibility mode, or AppHelp for a specific application.

segment.source: To query by using the Program Properties tab
segment.target: To query by using the Program Properties tab

segment.source: On the Compatibility Administrator toolbar, click Query.
segment.target: On the Compatibility Administrator toolbar, click Query.

segment.source: In the Look in drop-down list, select the appropriate database type to search.
segment.target: In the Look in drop-down list, select the appropriate database type to search.

segment.source: Type the location of the application you are searching for into the Search for the Application field.
segment.target: Type the location of the application you are searching for into the Search for the Application field.

segment.source: This name should be the same as the name in the Applications area (left pane) of Compatibility Administrator.
segment.target: This name should be the same as the name in the Applications area (left pane) of Compatibility Administrator.

segment.source: Type the application executable (.exe) file name into the Search for the File box.
segment.target: Type the application executable (.exe) file name into the Search for the File box.

segment.source: If you leave this box blank, the percent (%) sign appears as a wildcard to search for any file.
segment.target: If you leave this box blank, the percent (%) sign appears as a wildcard to search for any file.

segment.source: You must designate the executable name that was given when the compatibility fix was added to the database.
segment.target: You must designate the executable name that was given when the compatibility fix was added to the database.

segment.source: Optionally, select the check box for one of the following types of compatibility fix:
segment.target: Optionally, select the check box for one of the following types of compatibility fix:

segment.source: Compatibility Modes
segment.target: Compatibility Modes

segment.source: Compatibility Fixes
segment.target: Compatibility Fixes

segment.source: Application Helps
segment.target: Application Helps

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: If you do not select any of the check boxes, the search will look for all types of compatibility fixes.
segment.target: If you do not select any of the check boxes, the search will look for all types of compatibility fixes.

segment.source: Do not select multiple check boxes because only applications that match all of the requirements will appear.
segment.target: Do not select multiple check boxes because only applications that match all of the requirements will appear.

segment.source: Click Find Now.
segment.target: Click Find Now.

segment.source: The query runs and the results of the query are displayed in the lower pane.
segment.target: The query runs and the results of the query are displayed in the lower pane.

segment.source: Querying by Using the Fix Properties Tab
segment.target: Querying by Using the Fix Properties Tab

segment.source: You can use the Fix Properties tab of the Query tool to search for any application affected by a specific compatibility fix or a compatibility mode.
segment.target: You can use the Fix Properties tab of the Query tool to search for any application affected by a specific compatibility fix or a compatibility mode.

segment.source: For example, you can search for any application affected by the ProfilesSetup compatibility mode.
segment.target: For example, you can search for any application affected by the ProfilesSetup compatibility mode.

segment.source: To query by using the Fix Properties tab
segment.target: To query by using the Fix Properties tab

segment.source: On the Compatibility Administrator toolbar, click Query.
segment.target: On the Compatibility Administrator toolbar, click Query.

segment.source: Click the Fix Properties tab.
segment.target: Click the Fix Properties tab.

segment.source: In the Look in drop-down list, select the appropriate database type to search.
segment.target: In the Look in drop-down list, select the appropriate database type to search.

segment.source: Type the name of the compatibility fix or compatibility mode into the Search for programs fixed using field.
segment.target: Type the name of the compatibility fix or compatibility mode into the Search for programs fixed using field.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can use the percent (%) symbol as a wildcard in your fix-properties query, as a substitute for any string of zero or more characters.
segment.target: You can use the percent (%) symbol as a wildcard in your fix-properties query, as a substitute for any string of zero or more characters.

segment.source: Select the check box for either Search in Compatibility Fixes or Search in Compatibility Modes.
segment.target: Select the check box for either Search in Compatibility Fixes or Search in Compatibility Modes.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Your text must match the type of compatibility fix or mode for which you are performing the query.
segment.target: Your text must match the type of compatibility fix or mode for which you are performing the query.

segment.source: For example, entering the name of a compatibility fix and selecting the compatibility mode check box will not return any results.
segment.target: For example, entering the name of a compatibility fix and selecting the compatibility mode check box will not return any results.

segment.source: Additionally, if you select both check boxes, the query will search for the fix by compatibility mode and compatibility fix.
segment.target: Additionally, if you select both check boxes, the query will search for the fix by compatibility mode and compatibility fix.

segment.source: Only applications that match both requirements appear.
segment.target: Only applications that match both requirements appear.

segment.source: Click Find Now.
segment.target: Click Find Now.

segment.source: The query runs and the results of the query are displayed in the lower pane.
segment.target: The query runs and the results of the query are displayed in the lower pane.

segment.source: Querying by Using the Fix Description Tab
segment.target: Querying by Using the Fix Description Tab

segment.source: You can use the Fix Description tab of the Query tool to add parameters that enable you to search your compatibility databases by application title or solution description text.
segment.target: You can use the Fix Description tab of the Query tool to add parameters that enable you to search your compatibility databases by application title or solution description text.

segment.source: To query by using the Fix Description tab
segment.target: To query by using the Fix Description tab

segment.source: On the Compatibility Administrator toolbar, click Query.
segment.target: On the Compatibility Administrator toolbar, click Query.

segment.source: Click the Fix Description tab.
segment.target: Click the Fix Description tab.

segment.source: In the Look in drop-down list, select the appropriate database type to search.
segment.target: In the Look in drop-down list, select the appropriate database type to search.

segment.source: Type your search keywords into the box Words to look for.
segment.target: Type your search keywords into the box Words to look for.

segment.source: Use commas to separate multiple keywords.
segment.target: Use commas to separate multiple keywords.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: You cannot use wildcards as part of the Fix Description search query because the default behavior is to search for any entry that meets your search criteria.
segment.target: You cannot use wildcards as part of the Fix Description search query because the default behavior is to search for any entry that meets your search criteria.

segment.source: Refine your search by selecting Match any word or Match all words from the drop-down list.
segment.target: Refine your search by selecting Match any word or Match all words from the drop-down list.

segment.source: Click Find Now.
segment.target: Click Find Now.

segment.source: The query runs and the results of the query are displayed in the lower pane.
segment.target: The query runs and the results of the query are displayed in the lower pane.

segment.source: Querying by Using the Fix Description Tab
segment.target: Querying by Using the Fix Description Tab

segment.source: You can use the Fix Description tab of the Query tool to add additional SQL Server SELECT and WHERE clauses to your search criteria.
segment.target: You can use the Fix Description tab of the Query tool to add additional SQL Server SELECT and WHERE clauses to your search criteria.

segment.source: To query by using the Advanced tab
segment.target: To query by using the Advanced tab

segment.source: On the Compatibility Administrator toolbar, click Query.
segment.target: On the Compatibility Administrator toolbar, click Query.

segment.source: Click the Advanced tab.
segment.target: Click the Advanced tab.

segment.source: In the Look in drop-down list, select the appropriate database type to search.
segment.target: In the Look in drop-down list, select the appropriate database type to search.

segment.source: Select the appropriate SELECT clause for your search from the Select clauses box.
segment.target: Select the appropriate SELECT clause for your search from the Select clauses box.

segment.source: For example, APPNAME.
segment.target: For example, APPNAME.

segment.source: The APPNAME clause appears in the SELECT field.
segment.target: The APPNAME clause appears in the SELECT field.

segment.source: You can add as many additional clauses as you require.
segment.target: You can add as many additional clauses as you require.

segment.source: They will appear as columns in your search results.
segment.target: They will appear as columns in your search results.

segment.source: Select the appropriate WHERE clause for your search from the Where clauses box.
segment.target: Select the appropriate WHERE clause for your search from the Where clauses box.

segment.source: For example, DATABASENAME.
segment.target: For example, DATABASENAME.

segment.source: The DATABASENAME = clause appears in the WHERE box.
segment.target: The DATABASENAME = clause appears in the WHERE box.

segment.source: Type the appropriate clause criteria after the equal (=) sign in the WHERE box.
segment.target: Type the appropriate clause criteria after the equal (=) sign in the WHERE box.

segment.source: For example, DATABASENAME = "CustomDatabase".
segment.target: For example, DATABASENAME = "CustomDatabase".

segment.source: You must surround your clause criteria text with quotation marks (") for the clause to function properly.
segment.target: You must surround your clause criteria text with quotation marks (") for the clause to function properly.

segment.source: Click Find Now.
segment.target: Click Find Now.

segment.source: The query runs and the results of the query are displayed in the lower pane.
segment.target: The query runs and the results of the query are displayed in the lower pane.

segment.source: Exporting Your Search Results
segment.target: Exporting Your Search Results

segment.source: You can export any of your search results into a tab-delimited text (.txt) file for later review or for archival purposes.
segment.target: You can export any of your search results into a tab-delimited text (.txt) file for later review or for archival purposes.

segment.source: To export your results
segment.target: To export your results

segment.source: After you have completed your search by using the Query tool, click Export.
segment.target: After you have completed your search by using the Query tool, click Export.

segment.source: The Save results to a file dialog box appears.
segment.target: The Save results to a file dialog box appears.

segment.source: Browse to the location where you intend to store the search results file, and then click Save.
segment.target: Browse to the location where you intend to store the search results file, and then click Save.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: Compatibility Administrator User's Guide
segment.target: Compatibility Administrator User's Guide
